channel.title: Ipban on noobscape v2?
channel.description: the ip ban command acually works it says username ipbanned sucessfuly (shows thier ip) why does it say this if it don't really ban their ip just wondering anyone know anything bout this

item.title: Ipban on noobscape v2?
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

An easier way to create an IP ban for EasyRSC would be to load all banned IP’s from a text file, make it check the incoming IP on SessionRequest and if the incoming IP matches the IP in the text file, make it so it can’t connect.

Read full topic

item.title: Ipban on noobscape v2?
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“bonzakid, post:2, topic:335198”][quote author=skarletdeath link=topic=431598.msg3168104#msg3168104 date=1270183011]
the ip ban command acually works it says username ipbanned sucessfuly (shows thier ip) why does it say this if it don’t really ban their ip just wondering anyone know anything bout this
[/quote]
The IPBan function was not fully created in Noobscape.
You have to make it save preferably to a .txt file because everytime you restart your server, the IP will be unbanned. It does not save anywhere.[/quote]

doesnt it create a bat file that you run and it blocks the ip from connecting to your computer?

Read full topic

item.title: Ipban on noobscape v2?
item.dc:creator: @bonzakid bonzakid
item.description:
@bonzakid wrote:

skarletdeath:

the ip ban command acually works it says username ipbanned sucessfuly (shows thier ip) why does it say this if it don’t really ban their ip just wondering anyone know anything bout this

The IPBan function was not fully created in Noobscape.
You have to make it save preferably to a .txt file because everytime you restart your server, the IP will be unbanned. It does not save anywhere.

Read full topic
